context: <a0_0><b5_0>The forests<b5_0/><a0_0/> play a vital role in harbouring more than 45,000 floral and 81,000 faunal species of which <a1_0><b6_0>5150<b6_0/><a1_0/> floral and <a2_0><b7_0>1837<b7_0/><a2_0/> faunal species are endemic. Plant and animal species confined to a specific geographical area are called <a3_0><b8_0>endemic species<b8_0/><a3_0/>. In reserved forests, rights to activities like <a4_0><b9_0>hunting and grazing<b9_0/><a4_0/> are sometimes given to communities living on the fringes of the forest, who sustain their livelihood partially or wholly from forest resources or products.
